topic.title: A topic demo in big topic
Rebase ZeroNet infrastructure to IPFS or Dat
topic.body:
GitHub: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1669

Advantage: DHT, archiving system, bigger developer team & community, no repeated code…
Also a chance to migrate to Python 3.

Before I start to write code, is there any suggestion for me?

topic.title: ZeroBridge - ZeroNet proxy with pre-rendering
topic.body:
https://github.com/0polar/ZeroBridge

I think this is helpful for for public proxy (such as @d14na https://0net.io/)

topic.title: The Rise of Digital Totalitarianism: Shore of Disaster
Unlock all sites in 2 steps, safely
topic.body:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Ake2MmwxDgst5M8WqoyNLjDQj2pcPj5zL/

Step 1 is a workaround:
If you don't grant `Merger` permission, ZeroNet won't let you use `mergerSiteAdd` API.

topic.body: I lost one my site private key but backed up the master seed.

1513334954_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77W.body:
> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_362_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): MISSING COMMENTS

Repeat:
Comments [may not display](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroMe/issues/109), **but they are not lost**.
Recommend to use [|><||>](http://127.0.0.1:43110/sakana.bit) instead of official ZeroMe. 

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_362_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): CAN NOT HAVE 2 PROFILES ON 2 HUBS

Repeat:
This site help you unfuck ZeroMe multi-profile chaos, **migrate all data to a single hub**.
Never click "Create Profile" button again!

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_380_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): ZeroMe.db

`*.db` is just a **view-port** for SQL query, and no need to backup, just click "rebuild" button
Actually your data are stored at **various** `data.json`. For example:
```
List of hubs that have your data:
ZERONET_ROOT/data/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/data/users/1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/data.json
ZERONET_ROOT/data/1BLueGvui1GdbtsjcKqCf4F67uKfritG49/data/users/1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/data.json
ZERONET_ROOT/data/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/data/users/1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/data.json
```
When use ZeroMe Unfuck, your database will be automatically update.



---



> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_380_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): It told me the migration finished, published to 5/5 peers. Then: "Content publish failed." On your site in Firefox beta developer console appeared an Unhandled exception: https://snag.gy/61QZX4.jpg

"Content publish failed" is very common **when network is not well**, no need to handle this.
Actually I have considered how to handle exception: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1QHbf72f4vdx3QAxN1LTN9KP19J428Q85R/main.es7.js#line134



---



BTW,

1. What are your main hub? Are you banned in that hub?
2. In face, ZeroMe Unfuck is the automatic processing of Kaffie tutorial. **I think your data are broken when you manually copy and paste.**
3. A more simple way is create new account.

> [styromaniac](#comment_126_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Your comments on Piloth's posts are gone.

No, they come back, use sakana to view these.

1535211568_1P4KkC3wa5xtGD8m2MoBTf5p69G3X.body:
Centralized: Twitter
Decentralized: Mastodon
Distributed: ZeroMe

> [freeperson](#comment_12_1QJVjdwjqjGfFp6CtxzWTu19HRusPi9ds6): But there is more to ZeroNet than ZeroMe. Clearly ZeroMe is distributed because few people control the Hubs but what if ZeroNet as a whole?

Anyone can [start a new zite] or [clone and fork an existing zite] in anytime. No one can ultimately control.

I am running a local archiving system, but it is needed for everyone.

1538339081_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:

- iframe is bad, I would rather to use WebExtension instead of iframe wrapper.

1538390842_18dhkzcDYd4zCD8Vtb47ULAciCuoy.body:
> [noruka](#comment_3_18dhkzcDYd4zCD8Vtb47ULAciCuoyUFzet): And where can I find that if I clone the zite? Do I need to do it from the actual file?

1. Start a normal topic

2. Open your data file at `ZERONET_ROOT/data/YOUR_SITE_ADDRESS/data/users/YOUR_USER_ADDRESS/data.json`
(for example `ZERONET_ROOT/data/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/data/users/18dhkzcDYd4zCD8Vtb47ULAciCuoyUFzet/data.json`)

3. Add line `"type": "group",` to your topic, [like this](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/14ytAKDfNjArMTqGecTi7ginG3aZTsRAum/1538400166)

---

demo: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topics:1538394198_14ytAKDfNjArMTqGecTi7ginG3aZTsRAum/A+big+topic+demo

1538407463_14ytAKDfNjArMTqGecTi7ginG3aZT.body:
> [robione](#comment_55_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): doesn't the recent CloudFlare adoption and providing an IPFS gateway help?

This is also a good reason, but more importantly↓

---

I want ZeroNet focus on distributed web apps framework, and unite other distributed storage infrastructures together.

So finally network architecture will be like this:
- distributed web apps
- ZeroNet (distributed web apps framework)
- BitTorrent used by ZeroNet / Freenet / GNUnet / IPFS / Dat... (distributed storage)
- I2P (anonymous overlay layer)
- cjdns (replace IP/BGP)

And mature infrastructures have more code review & security audits. **[ZeroNet security is considered bad.](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=14041596)**

It is directly stored in HTTP Cookie. When your Cookie cleared, this key will lose, so need a backup.
But I **never register or login ID in public proxy**.

> [leftside](#comment_388_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): it means @d14na is the god of all those ghost IDs, doesn't it

Yes. A moral proxy should not remember id key, but there is **no guarantee**.
This is the reason of **never register or login ID in public proxy**.

NO, that is not owned by @nofish

1545423165_13CFz29UuNbUx54HmLqQBfxPQNN2F.body:
> Compression, Deduplication

This is the duty of file system, ZeroNet _can_ do this, but not so urgent.

> ZeroNet site importing

View your `data` folder in your ZeroNet client.

> Freeze

https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1802

The really most high priority:

- the strange smell of ZeroNet source code (I mean, I am difficult to understand source code)
- IPv6
- I2P
- DHT
- archiving (versioning)

1545441215_13CFz29UuNbUx54HmLqQBfxPQNN2F.body: You can directly read `.db` file. It is SQLite.

```
python zeronet.py --help
```

---

```
python zeronet.py siteSign {{address}}
```
(when your key is stored in `data/users.json`, you don't need to input the key)

---

```
python zeronet.py sitePublish {{address}}
```

1545615413_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJV.body:
Not recommended.
Due to network latency, you will encounter race conditions and your data may be lost.

> [leftside](#comment_460_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): We can't say the data would be lost. The data are just being updated by the same user id while they can be looked like being lost if the data updating interval between two computers with the same user id is too short.

You [create new Post1 on Device1] and you [create new Post2 on Device2] in same time, one of Post1 and Post2 will lost, depending on which timestamp is smaller.

Another ZeroNet defect: ZeroNet's data is file-based, not row-based.

See also: https://github.com/mafintosh/hypercore

> [leftside](#comment_463_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): No, I think...

That is your _think_, not the fact.
